html:
{% set current_date = frappe.utils.nowdate() %} {% set formatted_current_date = frappe.utils.get_datetime(current_date).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {% set formatted_date = frappe.utils.get_datetime(doc.offer_date).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {{ formatted_current_date or '' }}

Offer Letter

{{doc.applicant_name}} {%- set job_applicant = frappe.get_doc("Job Applicant", doc.job_applicant) -%} {%- if job_applicant.email_id == doc.job_applicant -%} {% if job_applicant.custom_address %}
{{ job_applicant.custom_address | replace('\n', '
') }} {% endif %} {%- else -%} {%- endif %} {%- set job_applicant = frappe.get_doc("Job Applicant", doc.job_applicant) -%} {%- if job_applicant.email_id == doc.job_applicant -%} {% if job_applicant.custom_location %}
{{ job_applicant.custom_location | replace('\n', '
') }} {% endif %} {%- else -%} {%- endif %}

Dear {{ doc.applicant_name }},

In reference to your application and subsequent interviews held with us, we are pleased to offer you the position of ‘{{ doc.designation }}’ in our organization on the following terms & conditions:

  1. You will be based at our office/plant in {%- set job_applicant = frappe.get_doc("Job Applicant", doc.job_applicant) -%} {%- if job_applicant.email_id == doc.job_applicant -%} {% if job_applicant.custom_location %} {{ job_applicant.custom_branch | replace('\n', '
    ') }} {% endif %} {%- else -%} {%- endif %}    , Gujarat or such other place it may relocate to.
  2. Please refer Annexure A for the compensation break-up agreed & accepted by you.
  3. As mutually agreed, you are expected to join the duty on or before Proposed {%- for row in doc.offer_terms -%} {%- if "Date of Joining" in row.offer_term -%} {%- if row.value -%} {{ ' ' }} {{ row.value }}. {%- else -%} . {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%}
  4. You will be on a probation period for six months starting from your date of joining.
  5. To avoid the offer being nullified the company will conduct independent reference checks as deemed fit.
  6. Your role is already described in the Job Description that was shared/discussed with you during the interview.
  7. You are required to submit self-attested photocopy of the following documents as listed below.
      {%- for row in doc.custom_required_documents -%}
    • {{ row.document_name or '' }}
      • {%- endfor -%}
  8. Your appointment letter will be issued to you on your joining.

Kindly signify your acceptance by affixing your signature on the duplicate copy.



Yours faithfully,
For {{ doc.company }}



Signing Authority

I, {{doc.applicant_name}} hereby acknowledge that I understand the above terms and conditions & compensation break-up as detailed in Annexure A. I hereby confirm that I accept this offer.

Candidate Name: {{doc.applicant_name}}
Signature_________________________________
name: Offer Letter with Annexture

html:
{% set formatted_date = frappe.utils.get_datetime(doc.relieving_date).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {{ formatted_date or '' }}

Candidate Name
Address

Dear {{ doc.employee_name}},

This in reference to your resignation letter dated Date of Resignation, requesting the Management to relieve you from the services of the Company.

Please note that we accept your resignation. You will serve your notice period up till the close of working hours on Date of Relieving. On completion of the notice period and clearance of all the dues outstanding against your name as per the full and final statement a relieving cum experience certificate will be issued to you.

You are requested to please connect with HR Department to understand the exit formalities and submit the Clearance Certificate in the prescribed format, so as to enable us to prepare your full and final statement.

Yours faithfully,
For {{ doc.company }}



Signing Authority
Title/Position
I accept the above
name: Resignation Letter

Offer Letter

{{doc.applicant_name}} {%- set job_applicant = frappe.get_doc("Job Applicant", doc.job_applicant) -%} {%- if job_applicant.email_id == doc.job_applicant -%} {% if job_applicant.custom_address %}
{{ job_applicant.custom_address | replace('\n', '
') }} {% endif %} {%- else -%} {%- endif %} {%- set job_applicant = frappe.get_doc("Job Applicant", doc.job_applicant) -%} {%- if job_applicant.email_id == doc.job_applicant -%} {% if job_applicant.custom_location %}
{{ job_applicant.custom_location | replace('\n', '
') }} {% endif %} {%- else -%} {%- endif %}

Dear {{ doc.applicant_name }},

In reference to your application and subsequent interviews held with us, we are pleased to offer you the position of ‘{{ doc.designation }}’ in our organization on the following terms & conditions:

  1. You will be based at our office/plant in {%- set job_applicant = frappe.get_doc("Job Applicant", doc.job_applicant) -%} {%- if job_applicant.email_id == doc.job_applicant -%} {% if job_applicant.custom_location %} {{ job_applicant.custom_branch | replace('\n', '
    ') }} {% endif %} {%- else -%} {%- endif %}    , Gujarat or such other place it may relocate to.
  2. Please refer Annexure A for the compensation break-up agreed & accepted by you.
  3. As mutually agreed, you are expected to join the duty on or before Proposed {%- for row in doc.offer_terms -%} {%- if "Date of Joining" in row.offer_term -%} {%- if row.value -%} {{ ' ' }} {{ row.value }}. {%- else -%} . {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%}
  4. You will be on a probation period for six months starting from your date of joining.
  5. To avoid the offer being nullified the company will conduct independent reference checks as deemed fit.
  6. Your role is already described in the Job Description that was shared/discussed with you during the interview.
  7. You are required to submit self-attested photocopy of the following documents as listed below.
    • Aadhaar Card
    • Pan Card
    • Bank Details – Cancelled Cheque
    • Relieving/Experience Certification of the past 2 latest assignments
    • Qualification Documents – Degree & Master (if Any)
  8. Your appointment letter will be issued to you on your joining.

Kindly signify your acceptance by affixing your signature on the duplicate copy.



Yours faithfully,
For {{ doc.company }}



Signing Authority

I, {{doc.applicant_name}} hereby acknowledge that I understand the above terms and conditions & compensation break-up as detailed in Annexure A. I hereby confirm that I accept this offer.

Candidate Name: {{doc.applicant_name}}
Signature_________________________________
name: Offer Letter

html:
{% set current_date = frappe.utils.nowdate() %} {% set reporting_person = frappe.get_doc('Employee', doc.reports_to) %} {% set formatted_current_date = frappe.utils.get_datetime(current_date).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {% set date_of_joining = frappe.utils.get_datetime(doc.date_of_joining).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {% set contract_start = frappe.utils.get_datetime(doc.custom_contract_start_date).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {% set contract_end = frappe.utils.get_datetime(doc.contract_end_date).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {{ formatted_current_date or '' }}

Consultant Letter



{{ doc.employee_name or '' }}


{{ doc.current_address or '' }}



Dear {{ doc.employee_name }},

We are pleased to avail your services on a Retainership basis in our {{ doc.designation }} at {{ doc.branch or '' }} from {{ date_of_joining or '' }} on the following terms and conditions:

  1. You shall offer and the company shall avail your services in our {{ doc.designation }} at Location as "{{ doc.employment_type or '' }}". You shall be officiated as Title.

  2. This arrangement is on principal-to-principal basis and you shall neither construe nor at any time claim to be an Employee of the Company or an Agent of the Company.

  3. Your appointment is on a full time basis and your office timings will conform to our regular working hours. You will also have to undertake official tours for Company’s work as and when required and as may be approved by the Management.

  4. Please refer Annexure A for your professional fee detail.

  5. During the continuance of your employment with us:

    1. You shall not divulge or disclose or cause to disclose to any person, association, agency or any Company the information and data to which you have access during your association with the Company.

    2. You will be responsible for safekeeping, maintaining in good condition and return in good condition and order of all properties and / or assets, which may be entrusted to you by the Company. The Company shall have the right to deduct money value of all such properties and / or assets from your dues and take such other action as it may deem proper in the event of your failure to account for such property to its satisfaction.

    3. You will abide by all the applicable rules and regulations, procedures and practices of the Company in force from time to time.







  6. The Company may allow your, absence from work for a maximum period of 30 days in a year without making any deduction from the professional fee. A proportionate deduction will be made for all unauthorized absence and absence beyond 30 days in a year. These leaves will be granted only if you a certain minimum number of days of attendance is recorded each month and year. The leave cannot be carried forward from one year to another year. You shall not be allowed to encash any un availed leave at the end of the year.

  7. During the period of your engagement/agreement period with the Company or at any time thereafter except in the course of performance of your duties in the Company’s services, you shall not use, divulge or disclose or cause to used, divulged or disclose to any person, association, agency or any Company any of the information, technical or commercial formulae or secrets concerning the business of the Company, which you may have acquired in the course of or as incidental to your engagement/agreement with the Company.

  8. If at any time in the opinion of the Company (which opinion shall be final and binding on you) you are found guilty of dishonesty, disobedience, disorderly behavior, negligence, indiscipline, moral turpitude or any other conduct considered by the Company to be detrimental to its interest, your services may be terminated without giving you any notice or compensation.

  9. During the tenure of this engagement/agreement and one year thereafter, whether you are in the employment of the Company or not, you shall not for any part of your time, either individually or in any other manner and either directly or indirectly work, negotiate for, enter the services of or be employed with or accept any consultation or supervision work whether honorary or otherwise with or be interested in or concerned with any person, firm or Company or body of persons whether incorporated or not and carrying on or engaged or interested in, or about to carry on or engage or interest itself or themselves in any business, trade, vocation, calling or occupation of like or similar or competitive nature with that of the Company and further shall not engage or be interested in any other business trade, vocation, calling or occupation of like or similar or competitive nature with that of the Company.

  10. This arrangement shall come into effect from {{ contract_start or '' }} to {{ contract_end or '' }}, and may be renewed from time to time by mutual consent in writing.

  11. Either party can terminate this arrangement any time before the expiry of tenure by giving one-month notice or by paying an amount equivalent to one month of Professional Fees in lieu thereof to the other party.

  12. You shall report to the {{ doc.reports_to or '' }}: {{ reporting_person.employee_name or '' }}, {{ reporting_person.designation }} & {{ doc.branch or '' }} or to such other person(s) as may be designated from time to time.

Yours faithfully,
For {{ doc.company }}



{{ doc.employee_name }}
{{ doc.designation }}

Emolument


ANNEXURE
Consolidated ({{ doc.salary_currency or '' }}) Sum Per Month {{ doc.custom_consultant_fee or "" }}
TOTAL CONSOLIDATED ({{ doc.salary_currency or '' }}) SUM Per Annum {%- if doc.custom_consultant_fee -%} {% set annual_fee = doc.custom_consultant_fee*12 %} {{ annual_fee or "" }} {%- endif -%}

You will not be entitled for any payment other than that mentioned herein.

Your responsibilities and your authority would remain unchanged as it existed before your retirement.

Insurance Coverage

You will be eligible for coverage under the insurances as under. You are requested to get in touch with the HR Dept. and understand the regulations in force at the time of your joining.

  1. Medical Insurance: Coverage for Self, Spouse & Children Company will bear 50% of the premium for Self and Spouse up to the maximum, the remaining 50% will be borne by you. Any Premium contribution for children will be borne 100% by you.

  2. Personal Accident Insurance: Coverage for Self only to the extent decided by the Company.

Please signify your acceptance of the aforesaid terms and conditions by affixing your signature on the duplicate copy.


Yours faithfully,
For {{ doc.company }}



{{ doc.employee_name }}
{{ doc.designation }}
I accept the above
name: Consultant Letter
Transfer Letter
Promotion Letter

html:
{% set current_date = frappe.utils.nowdate() %} {% set formatted_current_date = frappe.utils.get_datetime(current_date).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {% set retirement_date = frappe.utils.get_datetime(doc.date_of_retirement).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {{ formatted_current_date or '' }}

Retirement Letter



{{ doc.employee_name or '' }}


{{ doc.current_address or '' }}



Dear {{ doc.employee_name}},

We refer to the discussion you had with the undersigned, on the subject of your retirement from the services of the Company. Please be advised that you will retire from the services of the Company at the close of working hours on {{ retirement_date or ''}}.

You are requested to submit your Clearance Certificate in the prescribed format available with the HR Department so as to enable us to settle your accounts, at the earliest. The said format is enclosed herewith for your immediate reference.

Kindly sign and return the duplicate copy of this letter in acknowledgement of the original.

We wish you a good life and appreciate the sincere and exemplary services rendered by you to the company.




Yours faithfully,
For {{ doc.company }}



{{ doc.employee_name or '' }}
{{ doc.designation or '' }}
name: Retirement Letter
Relieving-Experience Letter

Acceptance of Resignation




{{ doc.employee_name or '' }}


{{ doc.current_address or '' }}



Dear {{ doc.employee_name}},

This in reference to your resignation letter dated {{ resignation_date or '' }}, requesting the Management to relieve you from the services of the Company.

Please note that we accept your resignation. You will serve your notice period up till the close of working hours on {{ relieving_date or ''}}. On completion of the notice period and clearance of all the dues outstanding against your name as per the full and final statement a relieving cum experience certificate will be issued to you.

You are requested to please connect with HR Department to understand the exit formalities and submit the Clearance Certificate in the prescribed format, so as to enable us to prepare your full and final statement.



Yours faithfully,
For {{ doc.company }}



{{ doc.employee_name or '' }}
{{ doc.designation or '' }}
I accept the above
name: Resignation Acceptance Letter

html:
{% set current_date = frappe.utils.nowdate() %} {% set formatted_current_date = frappe.utils.get_datetime(current_date).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {% set contract_agreement_date = frappe.utils.get_datetime(doc.custom_contract_agreement_effective_date).strftime("%B %e, %Y") %} {% set company = frappe.get_doc('Company', doc.company) %} {% set address_parent = frappe.get_all('Dynamic Link', filters={'link_doctype': 'Company', 'link_name': company_name}, fields=['parent']) %} {% if address_parent %} {% set parent_value = address_parent[0].parent %} {% set address_doc = frappe.get_doc('Address', parent_value) %} {% set address_parts = [] %} {% if address_doc.address_line1 %} {% set _ = address_parts.append(address_doc.address_line1) %} {% endif %} {% if address_doc.address_line2 %} {% set _ = address_parts.append(address_doc.address_line2) %} {% endif %} {% if address_doc.city %} {% set _ = address_parts.append(address_doc.city) %} {% endif %} {% if address_doc.state %} {% set _ = address_parts.append(address_doc.state) %} {% endif %} {% if address_doc.pincode %} {% set _ = address_parts.append(address_doc.pincode) %} {% endif %} {% if address_doc.country %} {% set _ = address_parts.append(address_doc.country) %} {% endif %} {% endif %}

INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR AGREEMENT



This ‘Independent Contractor Agreement’ (the “Agreement”) is made,

BEETWEEN

  1. {{ doc.company or '' }}, a limited liability company incorporated under the laws of the {{ company.country or '' }} with license number ______________________ and registration number ______________________ issued by {{ company.country or '' }}, Government of {{ company.country or '' }} and having its registered mailing address at ______________________________________________________________________________________________________ (the “Company”) being duly represented by Naveen Kumar ; and
  2. {%- if doc.gender == 'Male' -%} Mr. {%- elif doc.gender == 'Female' -%} Ms. {%- endif -%}{{ doc.employee_name}}, holder of {{ doc.country or '' }} holding passport no {{ doc.passport_number or '' }} residing at {{ doc.current_address or ''}} (the “Independent Contractor”).

WHEREAS

  • ________________________________________________. The Independent Contractor is based in the Territory with relevant experience and expertise in the field.
  • Owing to its expanding portfolio of clients and rapid sales growth in the Territory, the Company had offered appointment to the Independent Contractor to act in such capacity for the Company in the Territory, under the terms of the Offer Letter. The Independent Contractor accepted the appointment from the Company under the terms of the Offer Letter.
  • The Company had agreed to set forth the detailed terms of the Independent Contractor’s appointment in the form of an ‘Independent Contractor Agreement’.

THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises, mutual covenants and conditions contained herein, and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties hereby agree as follows.


  1. APPOINTMENT
    1. Appointment

      The Company has appointed the Independent Contractor to provide the Services for the Company, in the Territory.

    2. Term

      The Agreement shall be deemed to have commenced from the {{ contract_agreement_date or '' }}, and it shall continue for a minimum one year; or until (i) the novation of this Agreement, in accordance with clause 11 of this Agreement; or (ii) the Termination Date, whichever is earlier. Such duration shall be the term of this Agreement.

    3. Exclusivity
      1. The Company may at its sole discretion appoint other persons/entities in the Territory, in addition to the Independent Contractor with the same capacity and designation as the Independent Contractor or otherwise, in accordance with the Company’s business requirements in the Territory.
      2. The Independent Contractor, during the term of this Agreement, shall provide the Services exclusively to the Company, and shall not take up employment or an appointment similar to the one under this Agreement, for whatsoever duration, with any other entity, without obtaining the express written consent of the Company, to that effect.






    4. Overview
      1. It is hereby agreed and acknowledged that this Agreement:
        • is executed by and between the Parties for the Independent Contractor to provide the Services to the Company; and
        • shall neither be, nor deemed to be, either a contract of employment or a contract of agency, under the applicable laws of the Territory.
      2. Pursuant to clause 1.4(a), the Independent Contractor will be fully responsible to ensure that his/her appointment under this Agreement is duly legalised and/or recognised under the applicable laws of the Territory, and that there are no legal impediments to his/her appointment under this Agreement which may render such appointment void or illegal, at the Effective Date and thereafter. As such, the Independent Contractor shall ensure that he/she has obtained all necessary licenses/permits/authorisations from competent authorities in the Territory under the applicable laws, to lawfully perform his/her obligations under this Agreement including but not limited to the performance of Services, and to lawfully travel to such parts of the Territory, as may be required by the Company.
      3. The Independent Contractor at all times shall also be obliged to inform the Company of any changes in the applicable laws of the Territory, which may have a bearing on the Independent Contractor’s appointment under this Agreement.
      4. The Independent Contractor shall promptly notify the Company of any change in the legal or regulatory environment in the Territory that may impact their ability to perform the Services.
      5. The Company shall take no responsibility and shall not be obliged in any manner for any personal tax liabilities, medical or insurance costs, repatriation, housing, transport or any other such expense that may be incurred by the Independent Contractor in providing the Services to the Company.
      6. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 1.4(a), and notwithstanding anything stated elsewhere herein, the Company shall take no responsibility for payment of any monetary benefits (generally payable to employees under the applicable laws of the Territory) to the Independent Contractor, other than or in addition to the Service Fee, including but not limited to gratuity, retirement benefits, severance pay, pension or other end of service benefits.
    5. Offer Letter
      This Agreement shall upon execution by both Parties, supersede the terms of the any other offer/letter/document whether verbal, electronic mail or written.
  2. LOCATION AND TRAVEL
    1. Territory
      The Independent Contractor shall be located permanently in the Territory, from where the Independent Contractor shall provide the Services to the Company. However, occasionally the Independent Contractor may be required from time to time to travel to the assigned territory or country or any other location/places to the extent required by the Company for professional and/or work-related training.
    2. Travel
      1. The Company may at its discretion, require the Independent Contractor to travel and work to locations beyond/other than the Territory, on a temporary basis.
      2. For the Independent Contractor to undertake any travel, the Independent Contractor must ensure that he/she has obtained the prior written permission of the Company. The reimbursements in respect of the expenses and overheads must be pre-approved in writing by the Company following meetings held between the Parties, in advance.



  3. SERVICES COVENANTS
    1. General
      1. The Independent Contractor shall perform the Services, in a proper and efficient way with diligence, and to the best of his/her abilities and the standards required by the Company. The Services from time to time may be extended or changed as per the ongoing relationship with the Company and the Independent Contractor will ensure that such changes are taken into consideration as part of the Company’s instructions.
      2. The Independent Contractor shall maintain accurate and complete records of all work performed and provide regular updates to the Company as specified in Schedule A.
      3. The Independent Contractor shall always work in a time-bound manner and complete his/her work as part of the Services within the time-limits determined by the Company.
    2. Reporting and Reachability
      1. Reporting
        The Independent Contractor shall follow the reporting pattern, advised by the Company from time to time.
      2. Reachability
        The Independent Contractor shall at all times, ensure that he/she is reachable for communication by the Company on email and telephone or via any other means of communication based on the internet.
    3. Requirements
      1. The Independent Contractor acknowledges that a personal laptop, a smart mobile phone, a local mobile number and a sustainable internet connection for both the mobile phone and home office (3G for mobile phone and minimum 12mbps for home office) are requirements for his/her work as an Independent Contractor. It is therefore agreed that the Independent Contractor shall be responsible to procure and activate all of the above at his/her own expense. It shall also be the Independent Contractor’s responsibility to keep all such devices in good working condition post commencement of his/her work. The Company shall not provide laptops, mobile phones and/or any other devices to the Independent Contractor, unless otherwise agreed.
      2. The Independent Contractor shall arrange on his/her own, a designated office space free from distractions for his/her work.
    4. Materials
      1. In all correspondence and contact with clients and/or potential clients of the Company, the Independent Contractor will use the Company’s stationery and email address. Any other materials such as proposal documents, business plans, training materials, hand-outs, folders, and other stationery items will bear the Company’s name and logo. The Independent Contractor must obtain the Company’s prior consent before using any other identity, especially where specific materials are subject to copyright restrictions.
      2. The content of the material referred in clause 3.4(a), must be agreed by the Company before being sent to the client or a third party. Such content shall not be used by the Independent Contractor for any other purposes.
    5. Quality
      1. It is hereby agreed that to maintain the highest possible standards of delivery to the Company’s clients in the Territory, the following points will apply on the Independent Contractor:
        • The Company shall seek regular feedback from the Independent Contractor.
        • The Independent Contractor shall at all times behave in a professional manner and will not do anything to impair the internal or external clients’ opinion of the Company but will see to enhance the Company’s reputation and brand-value in the Territory.
        • Every endeavour must be made by the Independent Contractor to meet and where possible exceed expectations set by the Company for the duties performed.



      2. If any problems affecting the provision of Services by the Independent Contractor current or in the future should arise then the Independent Contractor must advise the Company, at the earliest opportunity.
    6. Assistance in Litigation
      The Independent Contractor shall, during and after termination of appointment under this Agreement, upon reasonable notice, furnish such information and proper assistance to the Company as may reasonably be required by the Company in connection with any litigation in which it or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates is or may become a party in the Territory or elsewhere; provided, however that such assistance following termination shall be furnished at a mutually agreeable time.
    7. Limitations on Authority
      Without the express written consent from the Company, the Independent Contractor shall have no apparent or implied authority to (i) pledge the credit of the Company or any of its other ‘independent contractors’ or the Company’s employees; (ii) bind the Company under any contract, agreement, note, mortgage or otherwise; (iii) release or discharge any debt due to the Company unless the Company has received the full amount thereof; or (iv) sell, mortgage, transfer or otherwise dispose of any assets of the Company in possession of the Independent Contractor.
    8. Delegation
      The Independent Contractor may by obtaining the express written consent of the Company, delegate a part of his/her duties contemplated under this Agreement to third parties operating in the Territory, for effective execution of the Services. However, the Company shall reserve absolute rights to accept or reject the Independent Contractor’s request in this regard, and may require the Independent Contractor to provide additional information regarding the tasks to be delegated to third parties, and the proposed third parties themselves. The Company shall also reserve all rights to frame full policies in respect of delegation.
    9. Leaves and Holidays
      1. Annual Leave
        1. The Independent Contractor may avail annual leave in the manner set forth hereinafter.
          • The Independent Contractor may, subject to approval of the Company, avail 30 working days’ paid leave per annum, after the first anniversary of the Effective Date. The duration and division of such leave shall also be determined by the Company at its sole and absolute discretion.
          • In the event there are any unclaimed leave days, the Independent Contractor may request the Company to carry forward such unclaimed annual leave days to the next year. However, it shall be at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion to permit carrying forward of the unclaimed leave days to the next year, and the Company’s decision in this regard shall be final and binding on the Independent Contractor.
        2. In the event of termination of this Agreement, any unclaimed leave days will be compensated with a cash payment, provided the termination is not in accordance with clause 10.3 of this Agreement. If the annual leave has been availed before it was due only the proportionate leave entitlement will be taken into account while the excess, if any, will be adjusted against the end of service settlement in cash.
      2. Holidays
        1. Unless otherwise instructed, the Independent Contractor may avail paid leaves on statutory holidays in the Territory.
        2. In the event the Independent Contractor is required to work for the Company on a statutory holiday of the Territory, the Company and the Independent Contractor may agree to the effect that the Independent Contractor may avail any other day as a paid leave. Any such day of paid leave may only be availed within one month of the concerned statutory holiday and cannot be reserved or carried forward or encashed for compensation in lieu of leave.



        3. In furtherance of the provisions of clauses 3.9.2(a) and 3.9.2(b), it is hereby agreed that the Independent Contractor shall be liable to furnish the full list of statutory holidays in the Territory, within a reasonable time after the commencement of his appointment by the Company, and thereafter at the beginning of every calendar year.

  4. SERVICE FEE, OTHER BUSINESS EXPENSES AND TAXES
    1. Service Fee
      For performance of the Services by the Independent Contractor, and subject to the other provisions of this Agreement, the Company shall pay to the Independent Contractor, the Service Fee, every month.
    2. Payment
      1. The Independent Contractor shall at the end of every month, send the monthly invoice to the Company, prepared in the form provided under Schedule B of this Agreement.
      2. The Company shall pay the fixed Service Fee to the Independent Contractor, upon receipt of the Independent Contractor’s monthly invoice as a full payment per calendar month. The Company shall arrange to deposit the Service Fee into the Independent Contractor’s nominated bank account. The independent contractor futher agrees that the payment of such fee by the company is in during the third week of the month.
      3. It shall be the Independent Contractor’s duty to provide monthly invoices on time, following which the Company shall review the same, and proceed to transfer the Service Fee to the Independent Contractor’s designated bank account. Where deemed necessary, the Company may ask the Independent Contractor to produce additional details of expenses in the form of account statements or invoices, whereupon the Independent Contractor shall provide clear copies of all the requested documents to the Company at the earliest.
    3. Other Business Expenses
      The Company may reimburse the Independent Contractor for expenses’ overheads noted under the Other Business Expenses in the Independent Contractor’s invoice, subject to the condition that the same were incurred by prior approval of the Company. For this, the Independent Contractor must submit to the Company, documents containing itemized expense statements in the manner specified by the Company. The Company upon reviewing such statements and being duly satisfied of their validity and compliance with the Company’s requirements, may arrange to reimburse such expenses, by transfer of necessary funds to the Independent Contractor’s nominated bank account. In the event, Other Business Expenses are related to travelling, the reimbursement shall be subject to the provisions of clause 2.2 hereinabove.
    4. Taxes
      1. The Company shall not be liable or responsible for any personal or applicable tax obligations in the Territory or any statutory contribution of the Independent Contractor. It is hereby agreed that all such obligations shall be on the Independent Contractor only, and that the Independent Contractor shall be solely responsible for timely and due payments of all applicable taxes, in addition to fulfilling all obligations and filing of tax returns in accordance with the laws applicable in the Territory.
      2. Further to the preceding clause 4.4(a), it shall be the Independent Contractor’s duty to keep himself/herself aware of changes in taxation policies in the Territory which may have a bearing on the Independent Contractor’s performance of obligations under this Agreement. The Independent Contractor shall be liable to send preliminary information on the same to the Company, as and when any such changes take place in the Territory.
      3. The Independent Contractor agrees to indemnify the Company against any claims, liabilities, or penalties resulting from the Independent Contractor's failure to pay taxes or comply with tax obligations.




  5. HEALTH, SAFETY, AND INSURANCE
    1. Health and Safety
      The Independent Contractor hereby agrees and undertakes to keep himself/herself aware of all prevailing conditions in the Territory which may have a bearing on his/her health and general safety in the performance of the Services for the Company, including but not limited to social, political and environmental factors. In pursuance thereof, the Independent Contractor further agrees and undertakes to take all reasonably necessary precautions and measures for his/her general health and safety, at all times.

    2. Insurance
      The Independent Contractor hereby agrees and undertakes to personally ensure that he/she has appropriate insurance cover from a reputable insurer validly operating in the Territory, at all times during the term of this Agreement at his/her own cost, in respect of his/her health and life, in particular.
  6. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES
    1. Representations
      The Independent Contractor hereby represents that:
      1. The Independent Contractor is duly authorised to take up the appointment under this Agreement and provide the Services to the Company and that there are no impediments whatsoever under the prevailing laws of the Territory and to all other laws to which the Independent Contractor may be subject to.
      2. The Independent Contractor has all necessary qualifications necessary for taking up the appointment under this Agreement.
      3. All the Independent Contractor’s documents presented to the Company and/or the copies thereof are true to the best of the Independent Contractor’s knowledge, information and belief.
      4. The Independent Contractor holds a good moral character and as such has (i) never been dismissed by any of his/her previous employers/ from an appointment or job on grounds of moral turpitude; (ii) never been convicted of committing a heinous offence.
      5. The Independent Contractor is of sound financial capacity and no proceedings have been initiated under the prevailing laws of the Territory, in respect of his/her bankruptcy.
    2. Warranties
      The Independent Contractor further warrants that the Independent Contractor shall:
      1. At all times work diligently to the standards required by the Company and to the extent contemplated under the terms of this Agreement.
      2. Keep the Company informed of any impediments having a bearing on the performance of Services by the Independent Contractor for the Company.
      3. Keep the Company informed of any social, political or environmental events that may have a bearing on the Independent Contractor to provide the Services.
      4. Duly and fully comply with all obligations set forth or contemplated under the terms of this Agreement.
      5. Provide the indemnities to the Company in the manner set forth in clause 7 of this Agreement and adhere with the restrictive covenants stated under clause 8 of this Agreement.
  7. INDEMNIFICATION
    1. The Independent Contractor hereby agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Company for: (a) any loss arising out of misrepresentations made by the Independent Contractor or any unreasonable or negligent action or inaction on the part of the Independent Contractor (in the reasonable opinion of the Company) while in the course of carrying out activities pertaining to the Services, on behalf of the Company and as specified in this Agreement which causes the Company to suffer loss.



    2. any tax related matters pertaining to the income of the Independent Contractor in the Territory.
    3. any claims arising against the Company due to the Independent Contractor’s acts or omissions, without the Company’s approval.
    4. any act or omission of the Independent Contractor Personnel, contrary to the terms of this Agreement and prejudicial to the Company.

  8. RESTRICTIVE COVENANTS
    1. Restrictions on Trade
      1. It is hereby acknowledged as follows:
        • That all clients and prospects, suppliers or other people who are introduced to the Independent Contractor by the Company and with whom the Independent Contractor has or may have dealings with, on behalf of the Company, shall for all times be considered to be clients and prospects, suppliers of the Company; and,
        • That during the course of this Agreement, the Independent Contractor will have access to confidential and sensitive information about the Company’s business, its cost prices, margins, payments, and trading terms and so on; and,
        • That the Independent Contractor will also develop strong working relationships with the Company’s clients and prospects.
      Pursuant to the above, the Independent Contractor hereby agrees not to establish direct contractual links with any perceived or actual competitors of the Company or any direct contractual links with the Company’s clients/prospects or any of its subsidiaries without written permission from the Company. Further, any requests made by any of the clients/prospects of the Company to the Independent Contractor involving new business opportunities, referrals, or follow-up work which concerns the Company’s core business, must be passed to the Company or this will result in a breach of this Agreement.
      1. The fact that a client/prospect of the Company may have been introduced by the Independent Contractor shall not change or affect the Independent Contractor’s obligations noted under the preceding clause 8.1(a).
      2. Further, the obligations under clause 8.1(a), shall be valid during the period of this Agreement and for a period of 12 months after its termination.
    2. Conflict of Interest
      1. It is hereby acknowledged, understood and agreed that the Independent Contractor shall not work in a capacity similar to his/her appointment by the Company under this Agreement for competitors of the Company and is solely obligated to perform work and provide Services to the Company only during the term of this Agreement.
      2. At no time during the course of this Agreement, will the Independent Contractor act individually or through another agreement, or be employed by, or render services for, or act on behalf of, or have any interest in, any person, company or firm that might place the Independent Contractor in conflict with the performance of the Services to the Company under this Agreement, unless the Company has approved such action beforehand in writing, specifically and expressly.
      3. The Independent Contractor will not at any time disclose to any of the Company’s competitors, in any form, any confidential information, knowledge or documents pertaining to the business of the Company. For purposes of this clause 8.2, and in general for this Agreement, the term ‘confidential information’ and the obligations thereto must be read with the provisions of clause 9 of this Agreement, as well.




    3. Non-Compete Obligations
      The Independent Contractor shall not, directly or indirectly, be associated, in any capacity whatsoever; whether as an employee, partner, owner, consultant, or otherwise; with any company, firm, establishment or business enterprise which is a competitor of the Company and engages in a business similar to that of the Company: (a) in the UAE, at any point of time. (b) in the Territory, for a period of two years from the Termination Date of this Agreement, unless permission to do anything otherwise is specifically given in writing by the Company.
    4. Solicitation
      1. The Independent Contractor further agrees that during the term of this Agreement and following the termination of this Agreement, for whatsoever reason, or the expiration of the term of this Agreement, the Independent Contractor will not, in any manner or at any time, solicit or encourage any person, firm, company or other business entity who are clients, business associates or referral sources of the Company to cease doing business with the Company or to do business with the Independent Contractor.

      2. Further to the provisions of clause 8.4(a), the Independent Contractor shall also refrain from soliciting any employee of the Company or such other person who may be acting in the same capacity as the Independent Contractor in a different Territory, to cease working for/providing services to the Company, during the term of this Agreement or at any time following the termination of this Agreement.
  9. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY COVENANTS
    1. Confidential Information
      1. For the purposes of this Agreement, the term “Confidential Information” shall mean and include:
        • All records with respect to clients, business associates, customers or referral lists, contracting parties and referral sources of the Company and all personal, financial and business and proprietary information of the Company, its employees, officers, directors, and shareholders obtained by the Independent Contractor during the term of the Agreement and not generally known in the public are valuable, special and unique and proprietary assets of the Company; and
        • Any information (including but not limited to, commercial, marketing, technical, non-technical, training, documentation, forms, templates, a formula, a pattern, a compilation, a program, a device, a method, a technique, a drawing, a process, financial data, financial plans, product plans, trade secrets or a list of actual or potential customers that: 1. derives economic value, actual or potential, from not being generally known to, and not being readily ascertainable by proper means, by other persons who can obtain economic value from its disclosure or use; and 2. is the subject of efforts that are reasonable under the circumstances to maintain its secrecy; and
        • The Company’s trade secrets, including without limitation, any information regarding names and addresses of any customers, sales personnel, account invoices, training and education materials, administrative manuals, prospective customer leads, in whatever form, whether or not electronically accessible on-line.
      2. The Independent Contractor hereby agrees that during the term of this Agreement and following the termination of this Agreement, for whatsoever reason, the Independent Contractor will not at any time, directly or indirectly, disclose any Confidential Information, in full, or in part, in written or other form to any person, firm, company, association or other entity, or utilise the same for any reason or purpose whatsoever, other than for the benefit of and pursuant to authorisation granted by the Company.







      3. Upon the termination of this Agreement, the Independent Contractor shall immediately return all confidential records, documents, and other papers acquired or used during the term of this Agreement shall be the property of the Company and shall be returned immediately upon termination of this Agreement. Confidential Information, records, documents and other papers which cannot be returned shall be destroyed without keeping any copies thereof in any form whatsoever, subject to the condition that the Independent Contractor notifies the Company sufficiently of the items being destroyed.
      4. The Independent Contractor shall implement and maintain reasonable security measures to protect Confidential Information from unauthorized access or disclosure.
    2. Intellectual Property
      1. The Independent Contractor agrees that the property in all materials provided to the Independent Contractor under the terms of this Agreement, and all intellectual property and copyright herein, shall always remain the property of the Company.
      2. The Independent Contractor is authorized to use the copyrighted materials, trademarks, trade names and service marks of the Company, and its subsidiaries and partnerships solely in connection with the performance of his/her obligations as part of the Services, from time to time provided that nothing contained in this Agreement or otherwise shall effect or be deemed to effect an assignment, license or other grant of any right by the Company of any of the Company’s rights in or to such copyrighted materials, trademarks, trade names or service marks or any other intellectual property of the Company.
      3. The Independent Contractor shall be responsible to return to the Company, any copyrighted material belonging to the Company, and cease usage of such other copyrighted materials, trademarks, trade names and service marks of the Company, and its subsidiaries and partnerships, immediately following the termination of this Agreement, for whatsoever reason.
  10. TERMINATION
    1. Termination
      This Agreement may be terminated by either Party by sending to the other Party a notice, in the manner set forth under clause 10.2. This Agreement may be terminated without notice only by the Company in the manner set forth under clause 10.3 of this Agreement.
    2. Termination of Agreement – With Notice
      1. The clauses in 10.2 will only become applicable after completing one year with the Company. (a) The Company may terminate the employment relationship by duly notifying you in writing at least 30 days before the date of termination. If you intend to resign you should duly notify the Company in writing at least 60 days before the date of termination.
      2. The Company’s notice for termination of this Agreement, shall advise the Independent Contractor of any outstanding assignment commitments which should be completed by the Independent Contractor or reallocated through discussions with the Company.
      3. On termination of this Agreement, the Independent Contractor must return all working papers, manuals, books, disks, tapes, or any other property of the Company including any information pertaining to its business and will delete any materials belonging to the Company from their files and computers. Therefore, the Independent Contractor shall make arrangements reasonably ahead of the Termination Date, to ensure that all the Company’s properties are returned to the Company.
      4. During the period of notice, the Company shall not be liable to pay the Independent Contractor, anything other than the Service Fee and reimbursement for Other Business Expenses less any monies owed by the Independent Contractor to the Company.




    3. Termination of Agreement - Without Notice
      The Company reserves the right to terminate this Agreement without notice and without payment in lieu of notice, if the Independent Contractor:
      1. Does not carry out duties assigned to the Independent Contractor to a satisfactory standard and acts in a way that is detrimental to the Company; and/or
      2. Acts in a way that is not in line with the professionalism required which results in serious misconduct and can include, without limitation – abandonment, insubordination, poor performance, unlawful acts, gross neglect of duty and bankruptcy.
    4. Payment in lieu of Notice
      In furtherance of the provisions of clause 10.1 and clause 10.2 hereinabove, if a Party reduces the required period of notice prior to termination of this Agreement, for whatsoever reason, then such Party shall be required to compensate the other Party by an amount proportionate to the Service Fee for the number of days by which the notice period is reduced.
  11. NOVATION
    1. Following the provisions of clause 1.2 of this Agreement, the Parties may by mutual agreement decide to terminate this Agreement and execute another agreement of appointment with revised terms in novation of this Agreement.
    2. In the event of novation, the Company shall endeavour to clear all dues to the Independent Contractor under this Agreement and no dues shall be deemed to be carried over into the duration of the new agreement between the Parties.
  12. NOTICES
    1. Any notice or communication under or in connection with this Agreement shall be in English and in writing and may be delivered by courier or email to the addresses given in this Agreement or at such other address as the recipient may have notified to the other party in writing. Proof of dispatch of any notice or communication shall be deemed to be proof of receipt.
      1. in the case of a letter sent by courier, on the Business Day immediately following the date on which such letter has been left at the recipient’s address; or
      2. in the case of an email, the same day, if it is a Business Day, otherwise the next Business Day.
    2. The Parties’ postal addresses and email addresses are as follows:
      Company Name:{{ doc.company or '' }}
      Address:       ___________________________________________________________________________________________________
      Candidate Name:{{ doc.employee_name or '' }}
      Address: {{ doc.current_address or '' }}
  13. MISCELLANEOUS
    1. Survival of Certain Terms
      All terms by their nature intended to be beneficial to the Company and intended to survive termination shall so survive and remain in full effect.
    2. Amendments
      This Agreement may be amended only in writing, by the Independent Contractor and the Company represented by its authorised representative.
    3. Non-Waiver
      1. The failure or neglect of the Company in any instance to exercise any right, power or privilege hereunder or under the applicable laws of the Territory, shall not constitute a waiver of any other right, power or privilege or of the same right, power or privilege in any other instance.






      2. All waivers by either party hereto must be contained in a written instrument signed by the Independent Contractor and, in the case of the Company, by an officer of the Company (other than the Independent Contractor) or other person duly authorised by the Company.
    4. Entire Agreement
      This Agreement contains the entire agreement and supersedes all prior agreements and understandings, oral and/or written, with respect to the subject matter hereof.
    5. Severability
      If any provision in this Agreement shall be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, the validity, legality and enforceability of the remaining provisions shall not in any way be affected or impaired thereby.
    6. Acknowledgement and Acceptance
      1. The execution of this Agreement by the Parties shall confirm that the Parties have read and understood the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement and agree to be bound to them.
      2. Further, the Independent Contractor by executing this Agreement also confirms that he/she will act according to the vision, mission, values, and ground rules, as well as quality standards of the Company, in the manner contemplated in this Agreement.
  14. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION
    1. Governing Law
      This Agreement shall be governed by, and be construed in accordance with, the laws of the Territory.
    2. Jurisdiction
      The Parties agree that any legal action or proceedings arising out of or in connection with this Agreement (including a dispute regarding the existence, validity or termination of this Agreement or any non-contractual obligation arising from or in connection with this Agreement) by one Party against the other may be brought before the courts of competent jurisdiction in the Territory.
    3. Non-Exclusive Jurisdiction
      The submission of jurisdiction to the courts of competent jurisdiction in the Territory shall not preclude the Company from initiating any legal action or proceedings against the Independent Contractor in whatsoever jurisdiction that may seem fit to the Company, including the courts of competent jurisdiction in the UAE. Further, the taking of proceedings by the Company against the Independent Contractor in any one or more jurisdictions preclude the taking of proceedings in any other jurisdiction against the Independent Contractor, whether concurrently or not.
  15. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATIONS
    1. Definitions

      In this Agreement, unless otherwise explained,


      “Agreement” means this ‘Independent Contractor Agreement’ as amended or supplemented from time to time.


      “Business Day” means,


      • in respect of the Company, a normal working day in the country of operations which is not a national holiday or weekend; and,
      • in respect of the Independent Contractor, a normal working day in the Territory, which is not a statutory holiday or weekly rest day.

      “Effective Date” means the ‘Commencement Date’ as defined under paragraph 7 of the Offer Letter.




      “Other Business Expenses” means such expenses which may be incurred by the Independent Contractor for performance of the Services and are pre-approved by the Company in writing.


      “Parties” means the Company and the Independent Contractor; and the term “Party” shall mean any one of them.


      “Services” means the services listed under the Schedule A of this Agreement, which are to be provided by the Independent Contractor to the Company.


      “Service Fee” means the fixed services fee that shall be paid monthly by the Company to the Independent Contractor, pursuant to the other terms of this Agreement, and which in the context of this Agreement shall mean Country of Currency Figures/- (Figures converted in alpha numberical nos).


      “Termination Date” means the date of termination of this Agreement pursuant to the provisions of clause 10 of this Agreement.


    2. Interpretations
      1. Clause headings and the table of contents are inserted for convenience of reference only and shall be ignored in the interpretation of this Agreement.
      2. Words importing the plural shall include the singular and vice versa.
      3. Reference to a “month” means a period beginning in one calendar month and ending in the next calendar month on the day numerically corresponding to the day of the calendar month on which it started, provided that (i) if the period started on the last Business Day in a calendar month or if there is no such numerically corresponding day, it shall end on the last Business Day in such next calendar month and (ii) if such numerically corresponding day is not a Business Day, the period shall end on the next following Business Day in the same calendar month but if there is no such Business Day it shall end on the preceding Business day and “months” and “monthly” shall be construed accordingly.
      4. References to a person shall be constructed as references to an individual, firm, company, corporation, unincorporated body of persons or any government entity.
      5. References to a person include its successors in title.
      6. Reference to one gender shall include the other.
      7. The recitals and Schedules of this Agreement shall form integral parts hereof.
SCHEDULE A
THE SERVICES

During the term of this Agreement, the Independent Contractor shall provide the Services in the manner as defined in below mentioned Key Result Area & Key Performance Indicator assigned to him.

Job Responsibilities & KRA/KPI:



SCHEDULE B
FORM OF MONTHLY INVOICE

INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR INVOICE


Invoice No.:
Date:

Name: {{ doc.company or '' }}

Address:

Contact Number:

Email:

BILL TO:

Name:

Address:
Contact Number:
Email:

For the kind attention of:

Dear Sir/Madam,

I refer to the Independent Contractor Agreement dated – [____], and in pursuance thereof, I hereby submit my invoice for the month of ______________, of year ___________, as follows, for your kind consideration.

SRNO Description Amount (In USD)
1 Fixed Service Fee USD
2 Other Business Expenses
--> --> -->
Total

I further affirm that the above information is true to the best of my knowledge, information, and belief. Should you have any queries in relation to the above, please contact me.


Sincerely,


{{ doc.employee_name or ''}}



EXECUTION PAGE

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereby execute this Agreement as follows.


The Company:



{{ doc.company or '' }}

Naveen Kumar| Director
For and on behalf of
SMK / Royal Pinnacle




The Independent Contractor:


{{ doc.employee_name or '' }}

html:
{% set current_date = frappe.utils.nowdate() %} {% set formatted_date = frappe.utils.get_datetime(current_date).strftime("%e %B %Y") %} {{ formatted_date or '' }}

Appointment Letter

{{doc.applicant_name}} {% if doc.job_applicant %} {%- set job_applicant = frappe.get_doc("Job Applicant", doc.job_applicant) -%} {%- if job_applicant.email_id == doc.job_applicant -%} {% if job_applicant.custom_address %}
{{ job_applicant.custom_address | replace('\n', '
') }} {% endif %} {%- else -%} {%- endif %} {%- endif %}

Dear {{doc.applicant_name}}

In reference to your application and the subsequent interviews you had with us, we are pleased to appoint you as {{doc.custom_designation or '' }} in our {{doc.custom_department or '' }} at {%- set job_applicant = frappe.get_doc("Job Applicant", doc.job_applicant) -%} {%- if job_applicant.email_id == doc.job_applicant -%} {% if job_applicant.custom_location %} {{ job_applicant.custom_location | replace('\n', '
') }} {% endif %} {%- else -%} {%- endif %} with effect from {%- for row in doc.terms -%} {%- if "Date of Joining" in row.title -%} {%- if row.description -%} {{ ' ' }} {{ row.description }} {%- else -%} date of joining {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%} on the following terms and conditions:

You will be on probation for a period of {%- for row in doc.terms -%} {%- if "Probation Period" in row.title -%} {%- if row.description -%} {{ ' ' }} {{ row.description }}. {%- else -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%} Unless confirmed in writing, your employment with the Company will be deemed to be on probation.

In consideration of the performance of your duties and observance of the service rules of the Company and the terms and conditions specified therein, you will be paid emoluments as mentioned in Annexure A

You will be eligible for the statutory benefits and any other perquisites except Superannuation, in accordance with the rules governing the same and as may be formulated / modified from time to time in your respective location and or division.

  1. You will be eligible for {%- for row in doc.terms -%} {%- if "Leaves per year" in row.title -%} {%- if row.description -%} {{ ' ' }} {{ row.description }}. {%- else -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%} leave benefits as are applicable to other employees of the Company in your category in accordance with the rules and regulations in force from time to time. You are requested to get in touch with the HR Department and understand the Regulations in force at the time of your joining.
  2. You will not be entitled for any other remuneration/emoluments except as mentioned in Annexure A. The Company may reimburse the actual expenses incurred by you in the course of your duty if and to the extent permitted by the Company’s policies, rules & regulations in force from time to time. Please keep yourself acquainted with the same. For details you can contact HR.
  3. You will not be entitled to any expenses over and above what is included in the package. Conveyance and other costs will be reimbursed as per Company Travel Policy.

  1. During the period of probation, your employment can be terminated without assigning any reason by giving one day’s notice.
  2. After confirmation of your service as a permanent employee of the company your employment can be terminated on either side by giving notice or salary in lieu thereof. In lieu of deduction/recovery towards shortfall of your notice period during your exit from the organization, G.S.T. will be deducted/recovered as per applicable norms. Please refer below for notice period that will be applicable to you during your tenure with us.

    Executive & Below

    Manager & Above

    {%- for row in doc.terms -%} {%- if "Notice Period for Executive & Below" in row.title -%} {%- if row.description -%} {{ '- ' }} {{ row.description }}. {%- else -%} {{ '- ' }} {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%}

    {%- for row in doc.terms -%} {%- if "Notice Period for Manager & Above" in row.title -%} {%- if row.description -%} {{ '- ' }} {{ row.description }}. {%- else -%} {{ '- ' }} {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%}

  3. No notice of resignation from the service of the company will be effective, if it is given while you are on leave and you will not be entitled to avail any leave during your notice period.
  4. The Company may, however, at its sole discretion, allow you to consume your leave or may require you to proceed on leave during such notice period.

  1. You will be liable to be transferred to any division/department/office or establishment or any part of the organization in which case you will abide by the attendance rule applicable to the division/department/office/establishment of your posting without any extra remuneration.
  2. You will devote your whole time and attention to your duties and will not directly or indirectly for any part of your time carry on any business or profession or be associated in any business or service with any firm, Company or person.
    And further, you shall not enter, or cause to enter, in any business or other pecuniary relationship in your individual capacity or through your relatives, with any business associate of the Company, viz., Distributors, Dealers, Agents, Suppliers, Other Employees, etc. such activities will include investments, loans and advances/received or paid.
  3. You will be responsible for safekeeping, maintaining in good condition and return in good condition and order of all properties and / or assets, which may be entrusted to you by the Company. The Company shall have the right to deduct money value of all such properties and / or assets from your dues and take such other action as it may deem proper in the event of your failure to account for such property to its satisfaction.
  4. You will abide by all the applicable rules and regulations, procedures and practices of the Company in force from time to time.
  5. You will keep us informed of any change in your residential address or your social status. The communications sent to you on your last known address shall be deemed to have been received by you.

During the period of your employment with the Company or at any time thereafter except in the course of performance of your duties in the Company’s services, you shall not use, divulge or disclose or cause to used, divulged or disclose to any person, association, agency or any Company any of the information, technical or commercial formulae or secrets concerning the business of the Company, which you may have acquired in the course of or as incidental to your employment in the Company.

If at any time in the opinion of the Company (which opinion shall be final and binding on you) you are found guilty of dishonesty, disobedience, disorderly behavior, negligence, indiscipline, moral turpitude or any other conduct considered by the Company to be detrimental to its interest, your services may be terminated without giving you any notice or compensation.

During the employment and {%- for row in doc.terms -%} {%- if "Tenure after Employment" in row.title -%} {%- if row.description -%} {{ ' ' }} {{ row.description }}. {%- else -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%} thereafter, whether you are in the employment of the Company or not, you shall not for any part of your time, either individually or in any other manner and either directly or indirectly work, negotiate for, enter the services of or be employed with or accept any consultation or supervision work whether honorary or otherwise with or be interested in or concerned with any person, firm or Company or body of persons whether incorporated or not and carrying on or engaged or interested in, or about to carry on or engage or interest itself or themselves in any business, trade, vocation, calling or occupation of like or similar or competitive nature with that of the Company and further shall not engage or be interested in any other business trade, vocation, calling or occupation of like or similar or competitive nature with that of the Company.

You will retire from the services of the company on attaining the age of {%- for row in doc.terms -%} {%- if "Retirement Age" in row.title -%} {%- if row.description -%} {{ ' ' }} {{ row.description }}. {%- else -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%} unless specifically extended in writing by the Management. The effective date of the retirement shall be the last day of the month in which you attain the age of {%- for row in doc.terms -%} {%- if "Retirement Age" in row.title -%} {%- if row.description -%} {{ ' ' }} {{ row.description }}. {%- else -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endif -%} {%- endfor -%}.

You will functionally report to the {{doc.custom_reporting_person}}, {{doc.custom_reporting_person_designation}} or to such other persons as the Management may assign from time to time.



Yours faithfully,
For {{ doc.company }}



{{ doc.applicant_name or ''}}
{{ doc.designation or ''}}



Enclosed: Annexure A:

Annexure A:

Compensation Break-up

Variable Commission:
  1. You will be paid Variable based on your individual & company performance. The payout of the same will be quarterly

Medical Reimbursement:
  1. If applicable, You will be eligible for reimbursement of Medical Expenses incurred by you for the treatment of self and family each year. To the extent of the limit mentioned above which will be paid once a year.

LTA:
  1. You will be entitled to receive each year an amount equivalent to your one month's Basic Salary, by way of Leave Travel Assistance on your proceeding on earned leave for not less than 5 days. The payment of LTA will however be subject to the Company’s rules and regulations in force and also as applicable under Income Tax Act.

Insurance Coverage

You will be eligible for coverage under the insurances as under. You are requested to get in touch with the Location Head and understand the regulations in force at the time of your joining.

  1. Medical Insurance:Coverage for Self, Spouse & Children Company. Please speak with the Location Head and understand the process for the same.
  2. Personal Accident Insurance: Coverage for Self only to the extent decided by the Company.

Kindly signify your acceptance of the aforesaid terms and conditions by affixing your signature on the duplicate copy.

Yours faithfully,
For {{ doc.company }}



{{doc.applicant_name or '' }}
{{ doc.designation or ''}}
I accept the above
name: Appointment Letter

html:
Exit Questionnaire Form


Employee Id: {{doc.employee or "      -      "}}
